items.title: Tariff-Driven Dollar Woes Help Brighten First-Quarter Earnings
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Tariffs unexpectedly devaluing the US dollar — and in turn boosting corporate earnings — was one of the few bright spots of the first-quarter earnings season in North America. items.title: Up 97% in 2 years, Is Walmart a No-Brainer Dividend King Stock to Buy Now?
items.author: Daniel Foelber
items.description: Walmart's business model has improved, but it faces challenges from tariffs and slowing growth. While a Dividend King, its valuation is high, and investors may find better opportunities in other stocks.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Walmart's business model has improved, but it faces headwinds from tariffs and slowing growth, and its valuation is high compared to historical levels and other Dividend Kings.
Microsoft has a less expensive valuation than Walmart, is still growing at a solid rate, is tariff-resistant, and has a 0.7% yield, making it a better investment option than Walmart.
Procter & Gamble, a Dividend King, yields 2.6%, which is higher than Walmart's 1% yield.
Coca-Cola, a Dividend King, yields 2.8%, which is higher than Walmart's 1% yield.
PepsiCo, a Dividend King, yields an all-time high of 4.4%, which is significantly higher than Walmart's 1% yield.
